scene.line: Well, hello princess. Nice of you to join me. I was starting to wonder when you'd come around, but you made it. Well done.
Let's get the formalities out of the way, yeah?
The strong, silent type, huh? That's okay. I can definitely work with that.
I'd offer you the deluxe tour, but it seems unnecessary and I suspect you're smart enough to have figured this out.
You're trapped in a room and clearly at the mercy of the wrong type of person to be expecting any mercy from.
Like most disappointments in life, there is a way out, but it requires some effort on your part. The key to getting out is in this room.

option.label: where's the key?
option.line: I expected a bit more from you. We did, after all, just go over this.
The key to your exit, and I know this might come as a bit of shock, is in this room. I'm going to need you to pay a bit closer attention.

option.label: why am I here?
option.line: Influence. Yours and others. Are you familiar with the Stanford Prison Experiment?

option.label: no keyhole
option.line: Well. That's certainly embarrassing. Let me fix that right up for you.
Well, go ahead. Give me a hand and I'll get you your keyhole.

scene.line: It's the kind of experiment you couldn't really do today. Not in the the light, at least. It still amuses how recent some of psychological transgressions are. Anyway, simple experiment. Students were brought in to set up a mock prison. Some of the student were prisoners and others were guards. The professor running the experiment placed himself in the role as warden. In retrospect, it's fairly unsurprising how quickly it started to degenerate.
The Standford Prison Experiment. Abu Ghraib. Good ole Charlie Mason and his "family" members writing on the walls in their victim's blood. Influence goes a long way.
It's interesting, sure, but it doesn't quite wash. Not every ghetto kid is a drug dealing murderer. Not ever politician is a backscratching prostitute for hire.
Not every CEO is an image obsessed sociopath. At some point you have to be responsible for the influence you receive, but also for the influence you exercise.
Hello princess. Nice of you to join me. I was starting to wonder when you'd come around.
Let's get the formalities out of the way, yeah?

option.label: interrupt
option.line: Influence. I hear you're a fan. We build up these reputations and then exercise them as influence. It's curious what we do with our influence. Like the notion that you're going to have any influence of how this goes by interrupting me. What I also find curious is what we do when our influence is subverted or, worse, completely undercut.
Tell me, how does it feel?

option.label: go fuck yourself
option.line: Very eloquent. I both suitably impressed and intimidated. Well done.

option.label: I want out
option.line: Perfectly reasonable request. Logically and emotionally sound. And I am perfectly happy to see you go, but it is going to take a bit of effort on your behalf.
Stoic in the face of adversity. It's admirable. Really. Colour me impressed

option.label: check door
option.line: The strong, silent type, huh? I can work with that. So, you're trapped in a room, at the mercy of the wrong type of person. There is only one way out and the key to doing so is in this room.

scene.line: You know, it occurs to me that forgetting to have a key hole may have just be one of the critical pieces I left out in my haste. It seems ridiculous to expect you to solve an incomplete puzzle, doesn't it?
Please, go ahead. I'll get this all straightened out.
Hello, princess. Nice of you to join me.

option.label: shut up
option.line: It's really starting to lose its charm already, isn't it? I agree. It's a bit tired. Doesn't matter. We are well on our way, aren't we?

option.label: what do you want?
option.line: What bring a person to a place like this, do you think? What brings someone to bring someone to a place like this? Take a minute. Consider it. What have you done that would bring you to a place like this? What have you done that would bring someone to bring you to a place like this?

scene.line: I know what you're thinking. "He can't possibly know that." But you're here, aren't you? So, logically, someone must know.
Now, if you wouldn't mind, we haven't all day. Feel free to figure it all out. The key to your way out is right in front of you.
Quite frankly, I'm a little disappointed it's taking you so long. Go ahead, let's try this again

option.label: rewind
Please, I haven't got all day.

scene.line: It's my little reality. You think I'd be much better at this. You know? It's so aggravating not being sure. Just not quite fucking getting it. So much of it, so much of this, is already in my head that it's obvious. I already know how this ends. What I don't know is what's in your head.
Do you just not understand? What is it? Don't you get it? Then again, maybe you do? Maybe you are perfectly clear on what's going on here and you are just fucking with me.
How much of your work will I do for you? How many fucking hoops will I jump through?
Or maybe I did over complicate it. It's hard to say. Either way, we can sort that out.
Don't bother, I'll do it myself.
I've decided it wasn't me. It was you. So, I've gone ahead and pared things back a little. Go on. It's right there, just for you.

option.label: what happens when I leave
option.line: Nothing you need to worry about just yet. Please, go ahead.

option.label: open box
option.line: Congratulations. You've found the key that leads your exit. Now, if you wouldn't putting that bullet into your head, that'd be great. Hurry now, before the excitement fades.

scene.line: You didn't think it's be that easy, did you? I can assure you, whatever control you think you have in this situation is an illusion.
Oh, no. That didn't fix it. Maybe the next try? Perhaps? Who knows? You could give it a go, of course. Or you could do what you know is right.

Do it! You wanted out and there's the exit, right in front of you. If someone was in the way of you getting out and you had that in your hand you would do whatever was needed to get them out of your way. You are in the way. Do what you need to do. Take the exit.

I think it's important to value time, but on insofar as that time itself is value. Is this remaining time valuable to you? Stuck here, running over the same ground? You take as long as you need to figure that out. I've as much time as you do. Truth be told, substantially more.
